knimeNode.name: Outlier Detector
knimeNode.shortDescription: Detects and handles outliers for all numerical columns.

intro.p: Detects and treats the outliers for each of the selected columns individually by means of interquartile range (IQR) .

To detect the outliers for a given column, the first and third quartile (Q1, Q3) is computed. An observation is flagged an outlier if it lies outside the range R = [Q1 - k(IQR), Q3 + k(IQR)] with IQR = Q3 - Q1 and k >= 0. Setting k = 1.5 the smallest value in R corresponds, typically, to the lower end of a boxplot's whisker and largest value to its upper end.
Additionally, providing grouping information allows to detect outliers only within their own group.
If an observation is flagged an outlier, one can either remove the whole row from the data or replace it by some other value.
Missing Values contained in the data will be ignored, i.e., they will neither be used for the outlier computation nor will they be flagged as an outlier.

tab.name: Outliers
tab.option:
Allows to select the columns for which outliers have to be detected and treated. If "Compute outlier statistics on groups" is selected, the outliers for each of the columns are computed solely with respect to the different groups.
Options:
Include: This list contains the column names for which the outliers have to be detected and treated.
Enforce Inclusion: Select this option to enforce the current inclusion list to stay the same even if the input table specification changes. New columns will automatically be added to the exclusion list.
Select: Use these buttons to move columns between the Include and Exclude list.
Search: Use one of these fields to search either within the Include or Exclude list for certain column names or name substrings. Repeated clicking of the search button marks the next column that matches the search text. The check box 'Mark all search hits' causes all matching columns to be selected making them movable between the two lists.
Exclude: This list contains the column names of the input table that are left out of the calculation.
Enforce Exclusion: Select this option to enforce the current exclusion list to stay the same even if the input table specification changes. New columns will automatically be added to the inclusion list.

tab.name: Groups
tab.option:
Allows to select columns to identify groups. A group comprises all rows of the input exhibiting the same values in each of the columns. The outliers will finally be computed with respect to each of the individual groups.
Note that if "Compute outlier statistics on groups" is not selected these settings will be ignored.
Options:
Include: This list contains the column names for which the groups shall be formed.
Enforce Inclusion: Select this option to enforce the current inclusion list to stay the same even if the input table specification changes. New columns will automatically be added to the exclusion list.
Select: Use these buttons to move columns between the Include and Exclude list.
Search: Use one of these fields to search either within the Include or Exclude list for certain column names or name substrings. Repeated clicking of the search button marks the next column that matches the search text. The check box 'Mark all search hits' causes all matching columns to be selected making them movable between the two lists.
Exclude: This list contains the column names of the input table that are left out of the calculation.
Enforce Exclusion: Select this option to enforce the current exclusion list to stay the same even if the input table specification changes. New columns will automatically be added to the inclusion list.

tab.name: General settings
tab.option: Allows to specify groups via the "Group settings". If the outliers should not be computed on groups the included groups from the "Group settings" are being ignored.
Allows to scale the interquartile range (IQR). The default is k = 1.5.

Process the table in the memory. Requires more memory, but is faster since the table does not need to be sorted in advance. If in memory is selected more accurate values of Q1 and Q3 are computed, otherwise these quartiles will entirely be estimated irrespective of the selected "Estimation type".
Note that the more accurate computation of the quartiles comes with higher memory requirements. If the additionally required memory exceeds the available memory this node will fail.

Typically the value of the quartiles is not part of the input, but lies between two observations. The estimation type allows to specify how to deal with this problem, e.g., by using linear-interpolation. A detailed explanation of the different options can be found here

tab.name: Outlier treatment
tab.option:
Defines two different strategies to treat outliers:
Replace Value: Allows to replace outliers based on the selected "Replacement strategy"
Remove Row: Removes all rows from the input data that contain in any of the selected columns at least one outlier

Defines two different strategies to replace outliers:
Missing values: Replaces every outlier by a missing value
Closest allowed value: Replaces the value of each outlier by the closest value within the allowed interval R. If the column type is an integer the replacement value is the closest integer within the allowed interval.

ports.outPort: Data table where outliers are either replaced or rows containing outliers were removed
